No, I use the same params.txt in each project. But what I found out now is =
that I've mixed up the constructor parameters; instead of passing the 9 as =
the output neuron parameter I passed it as the hidden neuron parameter. Aft=
er changing that I got one OutOfMemoryException after another. There's a bu=
g in Substrate.cs in line 133:

for (uint outputs =3D 0; outputs < outputCo=
unt; output++, coordinates[2] +=3D outputDelta)

should be

for (uint outpu=
ts =3D 0; outputs < outputCount; outputs++, coordinates[2] +=3D outputDelta=
)

I'm quite sure that I never touched this line of code. Unfortunately my =
initial problem is back - the visualizer produces different outputs. I sure=
ly overlook something, I have just no idea what it is.

Cheers,
Daniel
